title: Packers lose RB Jamaal Williams on first play to late hit from Eagles DE Derek Barnett
text:
The whistle blew, Philadelphia Eagles defensive end Derek Barnett came in late with a helmet-to-helmet hit and Green Bay Packers running back Jamaal Williams went down in a heap.

It was a scary way to start “Thursday Night Football.”

[Watch live NFL games on the Yahoo Sports app, here's how]

Scroll to continue with content Ad

Williams seemed to be knocked cold by the late, illegal hit. He was down for a few seconds, tried to get up and trainers had him stay down. He was put a stretcher and wheeled off.

Packers RB Jamaal Williams is being transported to a local hospital after being stretchered off the field — Michele Steele (@ESPNMichele) September 27, 2019

Williams had movement in his extremities, the Packers said. He was seen giving a thumbs up as he left the field.

One of the first players to go to Williams as he was strapped on the stretcher was Barnett.

Derek Barnett just injured Jamaal Williams. Scary hit pic.twitter.com/IHQP0d5pFI — Jordan Dajani (@JordanDajani) September 27, 2019

It was an unfortunate hit but Barnett looked remorseful. Intent aside, Barnett could have been ejected. The helmet-to-helmet hit, especially after the whistle with other Eagles defenders holding him up, was clearly dangerous. It’s one of the hits the NFL is trying to get out of the game. Late in the second quarter, Barnett had a strip-sack that led to an Eagles touchdown and a 21-13 lead.

Barnett stayed in, but Williams left the field on a stretcher, his night obviously done.

Jamaal Williams left Thursday night's game on a stretcher after a late hit. (Getty Images)

– – – – – – –

Story continues

More from Yahoo Sports:
description: Jamaal Williams was knocked out on a brutal hit by Eagles end Derek Barnett.
